title: People who say anything other than "gg" at the end of a match should qualify for mutes.
body:
"ez" = Muted.
"noobs" = Muted.
"Fuck my team." = Muted

Seriously. I've spent 40 minutes of my fucking life playing with you dipshits and all you can say after is "ez"? I've spent more time playing games with specific, individual strangers in League matches than I do any of my family on a day-to-day basis and I get treated to this shit.

If Riot wants to improve the game, mute people who are disrespectful at the end of a game.

replies.body: what about the infinite 12y's who apparently molest my mother every night? or the people that excessively curse or say gg at the START of the game. or the people that abuse people in CHAMP SELECT?

Those problems affect the outcome of the match but this %%%% affects how I feel at the end of the game.

I never feel satisfied or accomplished from League. It's always a %%%%ty feeling. Nobody is ever polite and it blows ass.
People say its OCE, i think its just everyone..

Just say, your %%%% can't even get inside the hole.

And they can't talk.
I report these people for negative attitude.
I say gg at first blood, first drag and if the adc on my carry hasn't got a min of 200cs at 20 min.

> [{quoted}](name=Sackboy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=9fkWAHjM,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-03-11T11:33:34.300+0000)
>
> I say gg at first blood, first drag and if the adc on my carry hasn't got a min of 200cs at 20 min.

Since when do bronze adc's get 10 cs per minute?

> [{quoted}](name=Batchy,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=9fkWAHjM,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2015-03-11T19:19:20.047+0000)
>
> Since when do bronze adc's get 10 cs per minute?

I'm not sure, you're bronze.. you tell me patchy.
Only time you should be offended is if it wasn't easy, otherwise you're just a sore loser.
I have every right to say ggez if it was. only stating the truth. not my fault you can't handle it.

"Nice game" = Muted?
"Well played" = Muted?
"Good job" = Muted?

Be a bit more specific.
